Recap: Dorian encourages Langston that she is no longer alone. John tells Bo that the judge awarded custody of Tommy to Todd and Blair. Happily, Starr tells Jack that their baby brother is coming home. Todd, enraged that Marcie had taken Tommy and disappeared, blames Michael for having been in on this with Marcie. Langston belittles Dorian for prying into her personal life. Cole downs Starr's spirits by telling her that he feels sorry for the McBains. Markko tries to console Langston when she confesses that her parents are dead. Michael tries to call Marcie, but she will not answer the phone. After Bo and John arrive at Michael's home, Todd insists that Michael be arrested for his part in the kidnapping scheme. The later it becomes, Blair and Starr begin to wonder what happened to Todd and his bringing Tommy home. Marcie heads for New Jersey with Tommy. Dorian arrives back home with Langston.
Transcript: Dorian: You're not alone, Langston, not anymore.
Langston: Really? Do you know something I don't?
Dorian: No, of course not, but --
Langston: But what? Death is pretty permanent, last I heard. For the past year and a half, no one has slept in this house but me. And since that doesn't seem to be changing anytime soon --

Dorian: Of course, you're always going to miss your parents. It must've been awful for you, hearing how they died so suddenly, so tragically. But you are a powerful young woman. And now that the secret is finally out, I'm sure with time --
Langston: Don't you dare tell me that I will be all right. I will never be all right again!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bo: Hey, John? Did it go as bad as you look?
John: That son of a bitch gave custody to Manning.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Starr: Ooh! Oh, my God, this is so awesome! Did you hear that? We got custody!
Cole: I know -- I was standing right here.
Starr: So when is the baby coming home? I mean, we have to get his room ready, right?
Blair: We've got a lot to do, you're right.
Starr: Oh, my gosh, I'm so excited!
Jack: Why are you yelling, Starr?
Starr: Can I tell him?
Blair: Sure, go ahead.
Starr: Um -- our baby brother is coming home, Jack. Tonight, he's coming to live with us.
Jack: Sweet!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: My God, she took him. She kidnapped him.
Michael: No, that -- that's not possible.
Todd: The hell it isn't. And you knew all along.
Michael: Marcie, what did you do?
Todd: You were stalling for time, weren't you? I want you to find this woman before she gets away with my son. Go. Go! Don't just walk out of here!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marcie: There's nothing to be scared of, ok? Mommy's here. We're just going for a little ride. Just the two of us, ok? That's all.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dorian: Huh. Langston?
Langston: I don't want to talk anymore.
[Dorian sighs]
Dorian: Would it be ok if I said something?
Langston: Since when has anybody ever stopped you?
Dorian: When you found out that your parents had died, to have suffered through such a tragic loss all by yourself must have been awful. But now that you have shared this secret --

Langston: "Shared it"? Is it called sharing when a person is forced to give something up? And you can stop feeling all good about yourself like you did something nice and mighty, because you didn't. I feel worse right now than I've ever felt in my entire life.
Dorian: But that's because you've been suppressing the pain.
Langston: You are not my shrink, and you don't know anything about me! So stop telling me what I'm feeling!
Dorian: You couldn't have kept up the way you were. You can't keep living without an adult to supervise you, to -- to provide for you.
Langston: Sure I can. And I was doing just fine -- being on my own and -- and making my own decisions about what to eat and what to watch on TV. And my parents left me plenty of money.
Dorian: A girl your age needs more than just money.
Langston: I have friends, too.
Dorian: Yes, of course you do. And they would've been happy to help you if only you had told them the -- the truth.

Langston: You just don't get it. I don't need help. I need to live my life and have everybody stop bothering me. My mother used to tell me that dignity was the most important thing that a person could have. And that means being strong, and not feeling sorry for yourself for being needy or pathetic.
Dorian: It's not needy or pathetic to want your friends to support you when you're going through a difficult situation. Oh, Langston, you and Starr are so close. How could you have kept it from her?
Langston: Because if I told anybody that -- that they had died, it would've made it real -- like it's doing right now.
Dorian: Oh.
[Knock on door]
Dorian: Just --
[Doorbell rings]
Dorian: You just stay. I'll take care of it.
[Dorian sighs]
Markko: Oh -- hi.
Dorian: Hi. What can I do for you?
Markko: What are you doing here?
Dorian: I asked first.

Markko: Well, I'm here to see Langston. She was supposed to be at my house for dinner. I've been calling, but her cell goes straight to voicemail, and -- is everything all right? Is she sick or something?
Dorian: No, no, she's not sick. Um -- it's just that something came up and she can't, uh, see you tonight. But I -- I promise, she will call you -- quite soon.
Markko: Wait -- I'm not going anywhere until I know Langston is ok.

Jack: Do you think our new baby brother likes cake?
Blair: "Cake"? I think that's a good thing. I think he'll love it. Maybe you guys can whip one up.

Cole: You know I'm happy for you.
Starr: Well, do you feel bad for Mrs. McBain?
Cole: Don't you?
Starr: Look, I -- I do, but feeling sorry for her isn't going to make it any easier.

Todd: Assess my ass. How much are they paying you --
Michael: You know what? Enough already, ok? Will you just shut up till we find out what's really going on?

Bo: I'm sorry, John.

John: How are they supposed to get through something like this? Hmm? That's their son, it's their life. What are they supposed to do, just hand him over? How does that make sense, Bo?
Bo: It doesn't. But it doesn't the other way, either -- having Manning be deprived of his own son. I mean, the only good thing that you could say about him, he does love his kids.

Bo: That'll change.

Langston: No. There's no one.
Dorian: That's where you're wrong. There's me.

Starr: Um, ok. I'll walk you out.
Cole: All right, well, good luck. I hope it goes well.

Cole: I told you -- I think it should just be a family thing.

Cole: Yeah. I mean, it's kind of a big event, and I don't think there should be any outsiders.

Cole: Ok, let's not start this again.

Cole: I know, I'm -- I'm trying. Really, I am. I -- I know once I get to know your brother, that things will get easier.
Starr: Look, I feel bad for the McBains, too, and I wish that there was a way that it could all work out so that nobody got hurt, but there just -- there wasn't.

Starr: Ok.
Cole: Hey -- I love you.

Starr: Ok. Good night.
Cole: Good night.

Jack: Ok.
